channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO

item.title: Report E-2025010399
item.description:
Report E-2025010399

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-01T00:52:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-23
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 23, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1791 was punctured in transit and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove the released product. All waste was containerized in one (1) 15-gallon drum and the damaged drum was placed in one (1) 95-gallon overpack.

item.title: Report E-2025010404
item.description:
Report E-2025010404

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-01T00:52:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-22
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 22, 2025 while conducting a site walk at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Henderson, CO an employee noticed free liquid around the bung of a drum that was loaded onto a trailer for outbound shipment. Approximately 3 ounces of UN3264 Waste Corrosive Liquid, Acidic, Inorganic, n.o.s. (nitric acid, sulfuric acid), 8, II, RQ (D002) released from the top bung of a drum (1H1) due to liquid expansion during freezing weather conditions. The container was removed from the trailer and was set aside to be overpacked. The impacted area was cleaned by Veolia personnel. No employee exposure or injury was reported.

item.title: Report X-2025011008
item.description:
Report X-2025011008

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-12
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found to be leaking. When a clean up agent arrived it was discovered that the package contained a battery. There were no markings on the outside box that indicated that the contents were a DG shipment. The spill agent then called DG Admin and the package is being held for disposition. There was also a second peice in shipement that did not leak but also held a battery and it is also being held.
